Description: A series of four battles fought by the Allies against German and Italian forces in the mountains of central Italy. The battles resulted in Allied victory, but at a high cost in lives and resources.
An amphibious and airborne invasion of Sicily by the Allies, part of the larger Italian Campaign. The invasion led to the downfall of Italian dictator Benito Mussolini.
A bombing campaign by Allied forces against the city of Rome, Italy. The bombing resulted in significant damage to the city and the loss of civilian life.
A battle between Allied and German forces in and around the town of Anzio, Italy. The battle was part of the larger Italian Campaign and resulted in Allied victory.
A series of Allied battles fought in Italy against German and Italian forces. The campaign resulted in the eventual defeat of the Axis powers in Italy.
A bombing campaign by Allied forces against the city of Milan, Italy. The bombing resulted in significant damage to the city and the loss of civilian life.
A major battle fought in the deserts of western Egypt and eastern Libya during the Western Desert Campaign of World War II. The battle was a decisive victory for German and Italian forces.
